title: Juvenile involved in shooting near Fern Creek dies
content:
LOUISVILLE, KY (WAVE) – A juvenile who was involved in a shooting incident near Fern Creek has died, according to Louisville Metro police.
MetroSafe said the shooting was reported at a home in the 9700 block of Hudson Lane around 8:35 p.m. Thursday.
Neighbors said they heard screaming from across the street and ran over to see what was wrong. When Jackie Churchill arrived at the home she found a boy with a gunshot wound to his head.
"I walked outside, we heard screaming and we walked between the houses. When we walked over there the young man he was sitting in his chair and his head was against the garage," Churchill said. "I immediately listened to the 911 operator she said 'lay him down.' I laid him down I immediately felt for the pulse. There was no pulse so I immediately started CPR. I never stopped and screamed for them to get my sister. She relieved me and then she did CPR until the police officer arrived to relieve her."
Churchill's sister, Gail Wheat, is a registered nurse. She also performed CPR on him, but knew there was little hope.
"I was just looking at this sixteen year old boy who lost his life," Wheat said. "We did the best we could. We never stopped."
Emergency crews shut down traffic to transport the juvenile to University of Louisville Hospital.
Louisville Metro police are investigating this incident as a death investigation. No additional details have been released.
